title: Muhsin Ciftci
text:
Hello!
I am a Ph.D. candidate in Economics at Goethe University Frankfurt School of Economics. My research interests lie within the intersection of international macroeconomics, climate change, and applied econometrics. I further analyze the textual data using machine learning techniques and combine it with macro-econometric models in my research.
Before joining Goethe University Frankfurt, I received a Master of Science in Economics from Middle East Technical University, and at the same time, I worked as a researcher at the research and monetary policy department of the Central Bank of Turkey.

Employment






PhD Intern, International Monetary Fund (IMF), Washington D.C. / USA, Summer 2023

Assessing the impact of climate-related regulatory policy announcements by local administrations as well as local newspapers on valuations of Latin American country assets via AI/textual analysis

Researcher, Central Bank of the Republic of Turkey, Research and Monetary Policy Department, Ankara/Turkey, 2016 - 2019

(Short Term) Inflation Forecasting : Conducted short term macro-econometric time series modeling and forecasting in the price analysis team using various types of modeling techniques. Mainly used time-varying parameter models, Bayesian VAR Models, disaggregate models, satellite models, and carried out model performance. Furthermore regularly contributed to the quarterly inflation reports, monthly price development releases, and ad hoc policy reports.
International Macroeconomics : Wrote policy reports and briefs on international economic developments, portfolio flows, growth, and their prospective impacts on the local economy. Closely following the key economic indicators and macroeconomic data and the impact on the export performance.
